alert.note: Alert for Concho; Runnels (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 10:12PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Runnels and western Concho Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1012 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Vick, or 9 miles northwest of Eden, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ballinger, Paint Rock, Eden, Lowake, Benoit, Eola, Millersview, Rowena, Vick, Ballinger Lake, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 1929 And Ranch Road 2134, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 380 And Ranch Road 381, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 765, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 1929 and Us-83 Near The Concho- Runnels County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Texas.
